intro: Ada, commonly known as the sacred lotus, is a tropical aquatic plant native to Asia. It belongs to the Nymphaeaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that bloom above the water surface. The plant has broad, heart-shaped leaves that float on the water, while its roots anchor in the muddy substrate. Ada is known for its symbolic significance in many cultures, representing purity and spiritual awakening. Its flowers typically range in color from white to pink and yellow, depending on the species.
